examples.copy: Some of the many web pages I've worked on over the years.
Surprise! I did this site, too. Responsive web design with a separate mobile style sheet.
Webpage for Tarela People: Luxury Hospitality Headhunter.
Webpage promoting the Z100's Jingle Ball concert in Madison Square Garden. A mobile version was also created for ~25% of total visitors.
Full website for the freelance graphic designer Monica Boeger.
Information page for St. Mary's charity. Complete with an interactive view of a proposed Activity Center as well as a way for visitors to create a playlist.
Page where visitors with accounts can download assets for the six New York Clear Channel radio stations.
Page where visitors with accounts can download assets for the six New York Clear Channel radio stations.
Users were able to log their miles run/walk/biked and the total of all users was added to span the distance from New York to Los Angeles.
Contest page for Sun Drop details events and prizes visitors could win.
Website for the massive 20 year planning of the town of Brookhaven. The first time I had done interactive elements like PHP forms, and LimeSurvey.
Reworked existing site to flash for a smoother, more visually appealing, experience.
In addition to web development, I also have a background in creating 3D models in 3ds Max.
A room in my parents house. A demonstration for a prospective client that later helped with my current occupation.
One of many views of a future ferry terminal and boat basin.
Full website for the freelance graphic designer Monica Boeger.
Another residential interior. Many measurements and pictures were used in creating this piece.
Work in progress of the exterior of a building in Hoboken. Also my first experiment with using Vray for textures and lighting.
A proposed tunnel for a college. The client was worried that the tunnel would feel like a cave, though the rendering showed otherwise.
You are West of a white house. There is a mailbox here.
